intro: Fuirena cephalotes, commonly known as the red-headed antler plant, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, showy flowers that are typically red or purple in color. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, dry seeds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for both horticultural and ecological studies.
